alert.note: Alert for Maries; Miller (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 15 at 4:54PM CDT until April 15 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Missouri, including the following counties, Maries, Miller and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 454 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Dry Fork at County Road 407, Maries River at County Road 211, Maries River at County Road 621 and Little Tavern Creek at County Road 220. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Belle, Vienna and Brinktown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
